TITLE.P: Procurement of Parallel Framework Agreements for Consultancy Services for NAV

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Directorate of Labour and Welfare, hereafter called the Contracting Authority, invites tenderers to a restricted tender contest for the procurement of parallel Framework Agreements for consultancy services. This is a procurement procedure where the Contracting Authority chooses which tenderers can submit a tender from those who fulfil the requirements in the qualification documentation.

The contracts must cover the need for competence that the Contracting Authority does not have access to in its own department on a given day, or where there is a need for extra capacity. The contracts can also be used for external quality assurance. The requested consultancy services are divided into competence areas, and independent tender contests will be held for each competence area.
The requested consultancy services are divided into 14 sub-contests/competence areas, and independent tender contests will be held for each competence area.

TITLE.P: Procurement of Parallel Framework Agreements for Consultancy Services for NAV — Recruitment Assistance

SHORT_DESCR.P: Full recruitment process of key personnel and managers from office manager level and higher levels.
Parts of the recruitment process of key personnel and of managers from office manager level and higher levels, such as:
Consultancy services for the recruitment process.
Assistance with process improvements and quality assurance for recruitment.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an extension for 1+1 year.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: The selection of tenderers must be based on the degree of fulfilment of the following qualification requirements, with the stated weighting:
— relevant experience from similar deliveries, weighted 80 %,
— a good and well-functioning quality assurance system, weighted 20 %.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Option for other NAV units (government part) to use the Framework Agreements.

TITLE.P: Procurement of Parallel Framework Agreements for Consultancy Services for NAV — Management Support/Development

SHORT_DESCR.P: — development of management groups and teams,
— measuring/following-up managers, including systems, tools and methods,
— advice on strategic management development with particular emphasis on digital transformation,
— support for the use of digital learning forms in management development.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an extension for 1+1 year.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: The selection of tenderers must be based on the degree of fulfilment of the following qualification requirements, with the stated weighting:
— relevant experience from similar deliveries, weighted 80 %,
— a good and well-functioning quality assurance system, weighted 20 %.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Option for other NAV units (government part) to use the Framework Agreements.

TITLE.P: Procurement of Parallel Framework Agreements for Consultancy Services for NAV — Business and Organisation Development

SHORT_DESCR.P: Advice, process management and process support for:
— business development and continual improvements (including methods and tools),
— organisation culture and diversity analysis/review and evaluation of the organisation,
— organisation design, work processes, roles and responsibility,
— methods and tools within strategic competence work, development, management and mapping,
— strategic staffing management, including the use of and interaction between recruitment, development, restructuring and discontinuation,
— organisation and personnel analyses, including obtaining and comparing data, analyses and decision bases,
— agile methods, such as design sprint, hypothesis-driven development, value measurements, team development, etc,
— technical advice on technological trends, how technology will renew NAV with technologies such as artificial intelligence, automation and data-driven decision support.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an extension for 1+1 year.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: The selection of tenderers must be based on the degree of fulfilment of the following qualification requirements, with the stated weighting:
— relevant experience from similar deliveries, weighted 80 %,
— a good and well-functioning quality assurance system, weighted 20 %.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Option for other NAV units (government part) to use the Framework Agreements.

TITLE.P: Procurement of Parallel Framework Agreements for Consultancy Services for NAV — Business and Financial Management

SHORT_DESCR.P: Consultancy services, methods and tools for:
— development of effect-based business and financial management,
— self-service and automatised finance and management processes (standard systems),
— digitalisation of management information (simple services and standard systems),
— expertise on the development of management information,
— analyses and insight as a basis for decisions and management signals,
— information security and personal protection on a business level.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an extension for 1+1 year.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: The selection of tenderers must be based on the degree of fulfilment of the following qualification requirements, with the stated weighting:
— relevant experience from similar deliveries, weighted 80 %,
— a good and well-functioning quality assurance system, weighted 20 %.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Option for other NAV units (government part) to use the Framework Agreements.

TITLE.P: Procurement of Parallel Framework Agreements for Consultancy Services for NAV — Data-communication

SHORT_DESCR.P: Specialist competence within LAN, WAN and network security:
— cisco Nexus N7K, N5K and N2k (environment with, amongst other things, FabricPath, MPLS, FCoE and OTV), Cisco ACI, Fiberchannel and Ficon Wireless and DNA,
— checkpoint, F5 (LTM, APM, WAF, ASM), Cisco ESA, Mcafee Web Gateway, DNS, Certificate management,
— general technical/architecture competence within network and network security, including cloud and hybrid topology,
— competence in automation within the field, penetration testing, Federated Identity Management and CASB technology, as well as technology within migration from On-prem to Public Cloud.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an extension for 1+1 year.

— a good and well-functioning quality assurance system, weighted 20 %.

SUITABILITY.P: Requirement: Tenderers are required to have a legally established company.
— Norwegian tenderers: company registration certificate from the Brønnøysund Register Centre,
— Foreign tenderers: certificate for registration in the enterprise register as prescribed in the legislation of the state in which the tenderer is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: 1) Requirement: Norwegian tenderers must have their tax and VAT payments in order.

Documentation requirements: Norwegian tenderers: A tax and VAT certificate from the tax authorities, not older than 6 months calculated from the expiry of the deadline for requesting participation in the competition.
2) Requirement: Tenderers are required to have good financial solidity. The requirement is fulfilled with a credit rating of “Good credit worthiness” or higher.
Documentation requirement: The Contracting Authority will obtain a credit rating carried out by Experian; see www.Experian.no

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: 1) Relevant experience from similar assignments is required.

Documentation requirement: the tenderer's 3 most important deliveries over the last 3 years, including a description of the assignments, their scope/value, date and recipients. The template in the qualification documentation, annex 2, must be used to document fulfilment of the requirement.
2) A good and well-functioning quality assurance system is required.
— an account of the company's quality assurance system, including a system for the development and maintenance of competence,
— any certificates issued by independent bodies.

INFO_ADD.P: Re point VI.2) Electronic orders will be used: Mini-competitions will be held through the Contracting Authority's tool for competition management, which is currently delivered through Mercell.
